name: Graylog-ContentPack-OpenNebula
summary: Graylog Content Pack for OpenNebula Frontend Logging
description: This Content Pack enables you to parse the logs which are generated  by OpenNebula Frontend  and system logs provided systemd-journal. The logs are parsed to enable dashboards, streams and structured search queries.

title.@value: parse systemd-journal logs from sidecars messages
add formatted timestamp_log field to ONE messages
add formatted log_level field to ONE messages
check belonging to messages from ONE

source.@value:
rule "check belonging to messages from ONE"

when
    to_string($message.SourceModuleName) == "onefiles"

then
end

title.@value: l-da-one-vms

description.@value: Lookup data adapter for OpenNebula VMs

title.@value: l-da-one-loglevel

description.@value: Lookup data adapter for OpenNebula log level

title.@value: l-c-one-loglevel

description.@value: Lookup cache for OpenNebula log level

title.@value: add application_name field (if missed) to systemd-journal logs messages
add converted log_level field to systemd-journal logs messages

source.@value:
rule "add converted log_level field to systemd-journal logs messages"

when
    has_field("message") && has_field("log_level_num")
    
then
    let converted_log_level = syslog_level(value: $message.log_level_num);
    set_field(field: "log_level", value: converted_log_level);
end

title.@value: add parsed fields to ONE Sunstone/OneFlow messages

query.query_string: NOT message:Condition check resulted in OpenNebula SSH persistent connection cleaner being skipped.
NOT application_name:(sunstone OR oneflow OR fireedge)
NOT message:Condition check resulted in OpenNebula SSH persistent connection cleaner being skipped.
NOT application_name:(sunstone OR oneflow OR fireedge)

title.@value: OpenNebula Cloud
ONE Fronts OS

description.@value: This pipeline for parsing operation system logs (systemd-journal) of front-end servers

source.@value:
pipeline "ONE Fronts OS"
stage 0 match all
rule "parse systemd-journal logs from sidecars messages"
stage 1 match either
rule "add converted facility field to systemd-journal logs messages"
stage 2 match either
rule "add converted log_level field to systemd-journal logs messages"
stage 3 match either
rule "add application_name field (if missed) to systemd-journal logs messages"
end

title.@value: check for ONE HTTP logs pattern in messages

source.@value:
rule "check for ONE HTTP logs pattern in messages"

when
    regex(
        pattern: "(?:GET|POST|HEAD|POST|PUT|DELETE|CONNECT|OPTIONS|TRACE|TRACE|PATCH) .+HTTP.+", 
        value: to_string($message.message)
    ).matches == true

then
end

title.@value: OpenNebula Frontends Stream
l-c-one-zone

description.@value: Lookup cache for OpenNebula zone id

title.@value: l-t-one-loglevel

description.@value: Lookup table for OpenNebula log level

title.@value: add vm_id and vm_name fields to ONE messages
add parsed fields to ONE FireEdge messages
l-c-one-vms
oned-config

template.@value:
define ROOT /usr/bin

<Extension gelfExt>
  Module xm_gelf
  # Avoid truncation of the short_message field to 64 characters.
  ShortMessageLength 65536
</Extension>

User nxlog
Group nxlog

Moduledir /usr/lib/nxlog/modules
CacheDir /var/spool/nxlog/data
PidFile /var/run/nxlog.pid
LogFile /var/log/nxlog/nxlog.log
LogLevel INFO


<Input onefiles>
	Module im_file
	File '/var/log/one/*.log'
	PollInterval 1
	SavePos	True
	ReadFromLast True
	Recursive False
	RenameCheck False
	Exec $FileName = file_name(); # Send file name with each message
</Input>

<Input systemd-journal>
    Module    im_exec
    Command   /usr/lib/nxlog/modules/input/systemd-journal-tail.sh
</Input>

<Output gelf>
	Module om_tcp
	Host 172.31.104.112
	Port 12201
	OutputType  GELF_TCP
	<Exec>
	  # These fields are needed for Graylog
	  $gl2_source_collector = '${sidecar.nodeId}';
	  $collector_node_id = '${sidecar.nodeName}';
	</Exec>
</Output>

<Output gelf-systemd>
	Module om_tcp
	Host 172.31.104.112
	Port 12201
	OutputType  GELF_TCP
	<Exec>
	  # These fields are needed for Graylog
	  $gl2_source_collector = '${sidecar.nodeId}';
	  $collector_node_id = '${sidecar.nodeName}';
	</Exec>
</Output>

<Route onefiles-route>
  Path onefiles => gelf
</Route>

<Route systemd-route>
  Path systemd-journal => gelf-systemd
</Route>

title.@value: add application_name field to ONE VMs messages

source.@value:
rule "add application_name field to ONE VMs messages"

when
    regex(
        pattern: "([0-9]+)(?=.log$)", 
        value: to_string($message.FileName)
    ).matches == true

then
    set_field(field: "application_name", value: "virtualmachine");
end

title.@value: add converted facility field to systemd-journal logs messages

source.@value:
rule "add converted facility field to systemd-journal logs messages"

when
    has_field("message") && has_field("facility_num")
    
then
    let converted_facility = syslog_facility(value: $message.facility_num);
    set_field(field: "facility", value: converted_facility);
end

title.@value: check for existence of fields in NXLog messages

source.@value:
rule "check for existence of fields in NXLog messages"

when
    has_field("message") &&
    has_field("FileName") &&
    has_field("SourceModuleName")

then
end

title.@value: add application_name field to NXLog messages from FileName field
add zone_name field to ONE messages
add parsed fields to ONE messages

source.@value:
rule "add parsed fields to ONE messages"

when
    to_string($message.application_name) == "oned"    ||
    to_string($message.application_name) == "sched"   ||
    to_string($message.application_name) == "monitor" ||
    to_string($message.application_name) == "virtualmachine" 

then
    let parsed_fields = grok(
                            pattern: "%{ONE_TIMESTAMP:timestamp_log} %{ONE_LOG}: %{GREEDYDATA:message}", 
                            value: to_string($message.message), 
                            only_named_captures: true
                        );
    set_fields(fields: parsed_fields);
end

title.@value: l-da-one-zone

description.@value: Lookup data adapter for OpenNebula zone id

title.@value: add formatted timestamp_http_reques field to ONE messages
check for ONE timestamp in messages

source.@value:
rule "check for ONE timestamp in messages"

when
    regex(
        pattern: "^(?:Mon|Tue|Wed|Thu|Fri|Sat|Sun) +(?:Jan|Feb|Mar|Apr|May|Jun(?:e)?|Jul(?:y)?|Aug|Sep(?:t)?|Oct|Nov|Dec)", 
        value: to_string($message.message)
    ).matches == true

then
end

title.@value: l-t-one-vms
OpenNebula Frontends OS Stream

description.@value: Messages from journald and OS services

title.@value: ONE Fronts

description.@value: This pipeline for parsing OpenNebula logs of front-end servers

source.@value:
pipeline "ONE Fronts"
stage 0 match all
rule "check for existence of fields in NXLog messages"
rule "check belonging to messages from ONE"
stage 1 match either
rule "add application_name field to ONE VMs messages"
rule "add application_name field to NXLog messages from FileName field"
stage 3 match either
rule "add parsed fields to ONE messages"
rule "add parsed fields to ONE Sunstone/OneFlow messages"
rule "add parsed fields to ONE FireEdge messages"
stage 4 match either
rule "add formatted log_level field to ONE messages"
rule "add formatted timestamp_log field to ONE messages"
rule "add zone_name field to ONE messages"
rule "add vm_id and vm_name fields to ONE messages"
rule "add formatted timestamp_http_reques field to ONE messages"
stage 2 match either
rule "check for ONE timestamp in messages"
rule "check for ONE HTTP logs pattern in messages"
end

title.@value: l-t-one-zone

description.@value: Lookup table for OpenNebula zone id

default_template.@value:
define ROOT /usr/bin

<Extension gelfExt>
  Module xm_gelf
  # Avoid truncation of the short_message field to 64 characters.
  ShortMessageLength 65536
</Extension>

<Extension syslogExt>
  Module xm_syslog
</Extension>

User nxlog
Group nxlog

Moduledir /usr/lib/nxlog/modules
CacheDir /var/spool/nxlog/data
PidFile /var/run/nxlog/nxlog.pid
LogFile /var/log/nxlog/nxlog.log
LogLevel INFO


<Input file>
	Module im_file
	File '/var/log/*.log'
	PollInterval 1
	SavePos	True
	ReadFromLast True
	Recursive False
	RenameCheck False
	Exec $FileName = file_name(); # Send file name with each message
</Input>

#<Input syslog-udp>
#	Module im_udp
#	Host 127.0.0.1
#	Port 514
#	Exec parse_syslog_bsd();
#</Input>

<Output gelf>
	Module om_tcp
	Host 172.31.104.112
	Port 12201
	OutputType  GELF_TCP
	<Exec>
	  # These fields are needed for Graylog
	  $gl2_source_collector = '${sidecar.nodeId}';
	  $collector_node_id = '${sidecar.nodeName}';
	</Exec>
</Output>


<Route route-1>
  Path file => gelf
</Route>
#<Route route-2>
#  Path syslog-udp => gelf
#</Route>
